content: worked back and forth over also prior to the toe the 25 29 31 35 37 41 sts on needle 2 the charts are always read from right to left turn work and start the heel flap by working and from bottom to top the set-up row 1 on the ws as follows set-up row 1 ws sl1 purl mc sts with mc and cc sts with cc to the end of needle 2 instructions switch to smaller needles or apply another larger needle of the same size for the heel and cuff the set up for the gusset leave the instep sts on hold onto the cable of the needle used in with mc and smaller needles co 54 60 66 the leg 72 78 84 sts distribute sts as follows 30 30 36 36 42 42 sts onto needle 1 and 24 should you prefer to use the same needle as in 30 30 36 36 42 sts onto needle 2 join to the leg please note that you have to be a bit begin working in the round being careful not creative when picking up sts along the edges to twist of the heel flap to be able to place the picked sts on needle 2 and then start at the beginning work *p1 k2* ribbing for 12 12 14 14 16 of needle 2 16 rounds of or to desired ribbing length turn work and continue working the heel flap back and forth with mc only and with the leg smaller or a spare larger needle starting on the rs as follows switch to larger needles if desired and attach cc set-up row 2 rs sl0 sl1 sl0 sl1 sl0 sl1 knit until the end of the needle turn work chart a row 1-5 once chart a is repeated 9 10 11 12 13 14 times on each row 1 ws sl1 p2 p1 p2 p1 p2 p1 k1 round *p2 k1* repeat * - * until 3 2 3 2 3 2 sts remain p3 p2 p3 p2 p3 p2 turn now take a moment to plan the length of the leg as the leg has to be finished after chart a work the established ribbing pattern back and row 18 you can adjust the final length of the forth slipping the first stitch on the needle leg not only by the number of pattern repeats knitting the knit sts and purling the purl sts but also by either working or omitting chart a until there are 24 26 28 32 36 40 mc row row 6-12 in total in the heel flap including set up row 2 or until the heel flap is of desired length either work chart a row 6-12 once as in the and you have just finished row 1 sample socks or omit them completely then repeat row 13-24 once twice as in the sample socks or three times and finally work row 13-18 once chart a is repeated 9
